intro: Maytenus grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered mayten, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when ripe. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid lowland forests. Maytenus grandiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
